The Regents of the University of New York have urged the development
of educational television since 1950. They believed then and are more
convinced now, that television presents an unusually effective means of
extending an improvement of educational opportunity.
In 1952 the Regents requested and received, from the Federal
Communications Commission, construction permits for 10 UHF stations
strategically located throughout the state. These stations were intended

At Cortland, New York, the Regents were able to establish a closed-

outlying areas are connected by coaxial cable. A special feature of this
